resources.string: What is this app about? Every year there is tons of traffic at Sac State. The goal of this app is to reduce traffic and show you alternative modes of transportation. This can help reduce traffic, carbon emissions, and reduce strain on your wallet.
I agree to terms and conditions

This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down This is where the terms and conditions will go. it may be long so the user can scroll down

Please enter in your home address above. This is to help us find what modes of transportation will work best for you. You may put a general location if you don\'t want to put your actual address, but that will reduce the accuracy of our recommendations for you.
image of whichever type this button will send user to

Here are the different ways you can commute to Sac State. Click \"Compare\" if you want to compare the different modes of transportation with each other. \nWe recommend you do that after viewing the different modes of. When you are done, please select finish tour to take our survey. You may come back to this information at any time possible
Thank you for using our app! We hope you\'ve been able to make wiser decisions on your travel plans to Sacramento State. Please take our survey so we may refine this experience for future users.
vehicle description, why you should use this vehicle, about 4–5 lines of text max

gas: 
insurance:
etc: 
per person: (if rideshare)
Average cost(min - max): avg cost
Electric cars are more environmentally friendly as it produces no carbon emissions. EV Charging Stations are available on campus.
Carpooling allows you to share the costs with a friend. CSUS offers carpooling permits and prime parking spaces.
~The toxic remains of its battery/plastics are placed into landfills.
~Estimated to save over 1.4 billion gallons of gas
~Estimated to decrease carbon dioxide emissions by 1.5 million tons each year
A convenient way to get around campus. Available for any student or employee with their OneCard present.
Jump Bikes are available all around Sac State\'s Campus!
“If you replace a car with a bike each time you go to work, you will save approximately 3000 pounds of greenhouse gas emissions each year.”
There are multiple bike cages at Sac State that always under supervision all day.
There\'s plenty of motorcycle parking it has low walk distances to class.
Walking is great to do! There\'s a lot of footpaths to get to Sac State.
Select the following to see the different types:

Click \"Next\" to see the next mode of transportation. \nClick \"Compare\" to compare the different modes of transportation. \nClick \"Finish\"if you think you have decided what you want to use to travel with
The standard way to commute, but not the most affordable.
CSUS offers cost efficient permits for this compact mode of transportation.
Public transportation services across Sacramento county.
CSUS has a bike shop that carries spare parts for your bike and offers repair services.
A simple and harmless way to commute at your leisure.
The electric bicycle sharing system you could rent anytime.
The most common form of transportation. Commuting via car is one of the most convenient modes of transportation for college students.
This mode of transportation helps reduce traffic congestion and CSUS campus has multiple motorcycle parking lots.

Sacramento Regional Transit is accessible and affordable for everyone. They provide bus, light rail, shuttle and para transit services. It\'s services extend to Citrus Heights, Elk Grove, Folsom and Rancho Cordova. As a Sac State Student, access to RT is included in your tuition, known as the Sac State Student Commuter.
A convenient mode of transportation that doesn\'t harm the environment and provides health benefits. CSUS campus has multiple bike compounds and provides bike locker rentals.
A free and easy mode of transportation that causes no harm to the environment and improves one\'s health.
The electric bicycle sharing system you could rent anytime.
Compare Two modes of transportation with each other
